pull.title: gui: Uppercase bech32 addresses in qr codes

rename.from: gui: Optimization for bech32 qr codes
rename.to: gui: Uppercase bech32 addresses in qr codes

events.body:
Concept ACK.
About this implementation: a bit odd that a GUI util function needs to parse addresses in order to differentiate between Bech32 and legacy addresses.

@jonasschnelli It could be done with a parameter but then `ReceiveRequestDialog::update()`, `ReceiveCoinsDialog::copyURI()`, `ReceiveRequestDialog::update()`, and `ReceiveRequestDialog::on_btnCopyURI_clicked()` would need a new parameter as well

verification.payload:

gui: Uppercase bech32 addresses in qr codes

events.message: gui: Uppercase bech32 addresses in qr codes

events.body:
> About this implementation: a bit odd that a GUI util function needs to parse addresses in order to differentiate between Bech32 and legacy addresses.

Very good point Jonas. It seems something that should happen at another level before passing it to this function. E.g. a flag somewhere to generate the beck32 address as uppercase in the first place.
@laanwj Are you saying that bech32 addresses should always be presented in uppercase?
No, that's not what I'm saying. But if you need one in uppercase it's probably best to do so closer to the source where it's generated.

Regardless of how it's done, is the end goal here to also have the address inside the QR code uppercase? 
As it's currently implemented (3407b44), we only get an uppercase address in the URI, and not for the other two addresses displayed in the QR code dialog. i.e:

![qr code](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/52569002-2fbf4580-2e4b-11e9-9bfd-2da4d0d1d0d2.png)

I feel like the current implementation makes the most sense.  It would be confusing to have addresses shown primarily in lowercase but when generating a URI it will be shown in uppercase.  Here it just has the address in the URI in uppercase for the optimization and the user never knows that the optimization occurred.
Concept ACK. I don't mind too much what the URI looks like, but it doesn't need the same optimization as the QR code, so my light preference is to keep that lower case.

NACK
See: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/12191#issuecomment-485384845

As [BIP 0021](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0021.mediawiki) provides usage of `?`, `=` and `&` characters which do not belong to the alphanumeric set, ~it is impossible to optimize QR codes by making addresses uppercase, unfortunately.~
@hebasto As I commented there, I believe yoi are misreading the wikipedia summary.

1. My previous statement regarding impossibility to optimize QR codes by making addresses uppercase is wrong (see [qrencode manual](https://fukuchi.org/works/qrencode/manual/qrencode_8h.html#a4cebc3c670efe1b8866b14c42737fc8f)).

2. It worth to mention [BIP 0021](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0021.mediawiki) allows further capitalizing:
> The scheme component ("bitcoin:") is case-insensitive...

3. What are benefits of this PR for users / developers / maintainers?

Re utACK 3407b446cc5ec0725c0505e3b933f43d86286ad5
Though I'm not super happy about the string parsing to detect Bech32,... but probably acceptable. Going to merge this.

issue.title: Uppercasing BECH32 address and schema in QR code
issue.body:
[Uppercase QR codes are easier to scan](https://github.com/btcpayserver/btcpayserver/pull/2060#issuecomment-723828348), so we should make the effort to uppercase whatever characters we can in the URI.

Since [Bech32 addresses are already uppercased by default in Bitcoin Core](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15371) I expect that shouldn't be a problem. Upper-casing the schema could be a different beast... but so far in my testing it seems that only CashApp implemented this in a wrong fashion. Also, before I changed it last year, BtcPayServer was uppercasing schema component of QR Code URI.

To make sure we're not creating problems for merchants, this time I would prefer we first test which wallets support different format and then decide whether:

1. We will uppercase BECH32
2. We will uppercase schema
3. We will do both

## List of tested wallets

Here is the list of wallets tested so far, feel free to contribute by testing with wallets you have.

Wallet Name | BITCOIN:BECH32 | BITCOIN:bech32 | bitcoin:BECH32 | bitcoin:bech32 | Validated By
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
Atomic Wallet |  |  |  |  | @brijananand
BitBoxApp |  |  |  |  | @Stadicus
BitBoxApp for Android |  |  |  |  | @Stadicus
Bitcoin Wallet Android (Schildbach) |  |  |  |  | @freerko

Blockstream Green |  |  |  |  | @britttttk

Trezor Suite |  |  |  |  | @prusnak
Trust |  |  |  |  | @Fichte42
Wallet of Satoshi |  |  |  |  | @Kixunil
Wasabi |  |  |  |  | @johnsBeharry
Zap |  |  |  |  | @britttttk 
Zeus |  |  |  |  | @davterra
Bitcoin.com (owned by Roger Ver, scammer) |  |  |  |  | @pavlenex

## How to test

A) Scan the following QR codes from your wallet.

### 1. BITCOIN:BECH32
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36959754/101982226-9c3b4380-3c72-11eb-989a-d9f6bed2c917.png)
`BITCOIN:BC1Q6APR55WRXTDTK3CJ6M69MXAYW99VVGTVDNVUNT?amount=0.00005142`
### 2. BITCOIN:bech32
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36959754/101982244-c260e380-3c72-11eb-8582-13c4d27583c2.png)
`BITCOIN:bc1q6apr55wrxtdtk3cj6m69mxayw99vvgtvdnvunt?amount=0.00005142`
### 3. bitcoin:BECH32
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36959754/101982350-942fd380-3c73-11eb-9140-c80064244568.png)
`bitcoin:BC1Q6APR55WRXTDTK3CJ6M69MXAYW99VVGTVDNVUNT?amount=0.00005142`
### 4. bitcoin:bech32
![4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36959754/101982373-c3464500-3c73-11eb-94da-2ce576c1bf3e.png)
`bitcoin:bc1q6apr55wrxtdtk3cj6m69mxayw99vvgtvdnvunt?amount=0.00005142`

B) Report results in the comments in table view if possible. For example
`Wallet| No | Yes | Yes | Yes |`

DO NOT SENT ANY FUNDS. Just test if the QR codes above can be scanned and report.

issue.title: Support of Uppercased Bech32 Addresses
issue.body:
Uppercased bench32 address in QR codes are recognized as an invalid format in multiple wallets for LTC payments (Ledger Live and Binance). I encountered this issue while using a BTCPay Server and testing litecoin payments with different wallets.

Since [Bech32 addresses are already uppercased by default in Bitcoin Core](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15371), Could this also be implemented in litecoin?

Here are a few screenshot with the error. 

![WhatsApp Image 2021-03-27 at 21 31 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11589611/112750273-fcf34f80-8fc7-11eb-9144-66332d8ed93a.jpeg)
![WhatsApp Image 2021-03-27 at 21 31 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11589611/112750274-fe247c80-8fc7-11eb-837d-14a500348fe3.jpeg)

comments.body: I don't like hardcoding this heredon't we have constants to use somewhere?
I looked around and couldn't find any constants, I could add them unless someone else knows if some exist already.

there's nothing on `ChainParams` ?
Edit: This returns the prefix (`bc` `tb` `bcrt`):
```c++
const std::string& Bech32HRP() const { return bech32_hrp; }
```
Yeah, you can test whether the address starts with `params.Bech32HRP() + "1"`.
You can get the global params object by calling `Params()`.
nit: space between bech32 and the ? operator.
